intro: Pachira subandina, commonly known as the Andean pachira, is a species native to the Andes region of South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its large, waxy leaves and showy, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows as an evergreen shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 10 meters in its natural habitat. Pachira subandina is adapted to a variety of soil types but thrives in well-drained, moist environments.
